txt.en: Thyrnir noticed that the Orcs of Gathbúrz have left their fire-oil supplies haphazardly piled about in the chaos of the Elven assault.

'Hello there, [placeholder]. Have you had a look down there in the Orc-camps yet? It's a real mess. Orcs and goblins aren't too good at staying organized when you put a good fright into them, from what I've seen.

'Anyhow, I noticed that they have got the oil for their siege-engines piled up in great heaps of boxes and crates, just lying about. That's dangerous...you never know when it might catch fire!

'If you were to steal a few of their fire-pots and use them to set the rest ablaze, I imagine it would help add a warm glow to these dreary slopes for the evening.'

Fire-pots and supply crates can be found in the Orc-forts throughout northern Gathbúrz.\n\nThyrnir has asked you to destroy the goblins' stockpiles of fire-oil by igniting them with the goblins' own fire-pots.
'Ha! I could see the blazes from here, [placeholder]! That will teach the fool goblins to leave dangerous toys lying about! Good work, my friend.'
Thyrnir at Thangúlhad in Gathbúrz.\n\nYou should report your success to Thyrnir.
Report to Fífil at Thangúlhad in Gathburz.
'The foolish goblins have left their fire-oil stores out where they can be tampered with...I trust that you will do what needs to be done....'
